018package com.scivicslab.actoriac;
019
020import java.io.BufferedReader;
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.InputStreamReader;
023import java.nio.file.Files;
024import java.nio.file.Path;
025import java.util.HashSet;
026import java.util.Set;
027import java.util.logging.Level;
028import java.util.logging.Logger;
029
030import org.json.JSONObject;
031
032import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActionResult;
033import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorRef;
034import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.IIActorSystem;
035import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Interpreter;
036import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.workflow.Transition;
037
038/**
039 * Level 3 wrapper that adds workflow capabilities to a Node POJO.
040 *
041 * <p>This class extends {@link Interpreter} to provide workflow execution
042 * capabilities while delegating SSH operations to a wrapped {@link Node} instance.</p>
043 *
044 * <p>This demonstrates the three-level architecture of actor-IaC:</p>
045 * <ul>
046 * <li><strong>Level 1 (POJO):</strong> {@link Node} - pure POJO with SSH functionality</li>
047 * <li><strong>Level 2 (Actor):</strong> ActorRef&lt;Node&gt; - actor wrapper for concurrent execution</li>
048 * <li><strong>Level 3 (Workflow):</strong> NodeInterpreter - workflow capabilities + IIActorRef wrapper</li>
049 * </ul>
050 *
051 * <p><strong>Design principle:</strong> Node remains a pure POJO, independent of ActorSystem.
052 * NodeInterpreter wraps Node to add workflow capabilities without modifying the Node class.</p>
053 *
054 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
055 */
056public class NodeInterpreter extends Interpreter {
057
058    private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(NodeInterpreter.class.getName());
059
060    /**
061     * The wrapped Node POJO that handles actual SSH operations.
062     */
063    private final Node node;
064
065    /**
066     * The overlay directory path for YAML overlay feature.
067     */
068    private String overlayDir;
069
070    /**
071     * The current transition YAML snippet (first 10 lines) for accumulator reporting.
072     */
073    private String currentTransitionYaml = "";
074
075    /**
076     * Set of changed document names detected by workflow.
077     * This replaces the /tmp/changed_docs.txt file-based approach.
078     */
079    private final Set<String> changedDocuments = new HashSet<>();
080
081    /**
082     * IaCStreamingAccumulator for cowsay display.
083     * When set, workflow step transitions are displayed using cowsay.
084     */
085    private IaCStreamingAccumulator accumulator = null;
086
087    /**
088     * Constructs a NodeInterpreter that wraps the specified Node.
089     *
090     * @param node the {@link Node} instance to wrap
091     * @param system the actor system for workflow execution
092     */
093    public NodeInterpreter(Node node, IIActorSystem system) {
094        super();
095        this.node = node;
096        this.system = system;
097        // Initialize parent's logger (used by Interpreter.runWorkflow error handling)
098        super.logger = logger;
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Executes a command on the remote node via SSH.
103     *
104     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link Node#executeCommand(String)} method.</p>
105     *
106     * @param command the command to execute
107     * @return the result of the command execution
108     * @throws IOException if SSH connection fails
109     */
110    public Node.CommandResult executeCommand(String command) throws IOException {
111        return node.executeCommand(command);
112    }
113
114    /**
115     * Executes a command on the remote node via SSH with real-time output callback.
116     *
117     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link Node#executeCommand(String, Node.OutputCallback)} method.</p>
118     *
119     * @param command the command to execute
120     * @param callback the callback for real-time output (may be null)
121     * @return the result of the command execution
122     * @throws IOException if SSH connection fails
123     */
124    public Node.CommandResult executeCommand(String command, Node.OutputCallback callback) throws IOException {
125        return node.executeCommand(command, callback);
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Executes a command with sudo privileges on the remote node.
130     *
131     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link Node#executeSudoCommand(String)} method.
132     * Requires SUDO_PASSWORD environment variable to be set.</p>
133     *
134     * @param command the command to execute with sudo
135     * @return the result of the command execution
136     * @throws IOException if SSH connection fails or SUDO_PASSWORD is not set
137     */
138    public Node.CommandResult executeSudoCommand(String command) throws IOException {
139        return node.executeSudoCommand(command);
140    }
141
142    /**
143     * Executes a command with sudo privileges on the remote node with real-time output callback.
144     *
145     * <p>Delegates to the wrapped {@link Node#executeSudoCommand(String, Node.OutputCallback)} method.
146     * Requires SUDO_PASSWORD environment variable to be set.</p>
147     *
148     * @param command the command to execute with sudo
149     * @param callback the callback for real-time output (may be null)
150     * @return the result of the command execution
151     * @throws IOException if SSH connection fails or SUDO_PASSWORD is not set
152     */
153    public Node.CommandResult executeSudoCommand(String command, Node.OutputCallback callback) throws IOException {
154        return node.executeSudoCommand(command, callback);
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Gets the hostname of the node.
159     *
160     * @return the hostname
161     */
162    public String getHostname() {
163        return node.getHostname();
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Gets the username for SSH connections.
168     *
169     * @return the username
170     */
171    public String getUser() {
172        return node.getUser();
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Gets the SSH port.
177     *
178     * @return the SSH port number
179     */
180    public int getPort() {
181        return node.getPort();
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Gets the wrapped Node instance.
186     *
187     * <p>This allows direct access to the underlying POJO when needed.</p>
188     *
189     * @return the wrapped Node
190     */
191    public Node getNode() {
192        return node;
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Sets the overlay directory for YAML overlay feature.
197     *
198     * @param overlayDir the path to the overlay directory containing overlay-conf.yaml
199     */
200    public void setOverlayDir(String overlayDir) {
201        this.overlayDir = overlayDir;
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Gets the overlay directory path.
206     *
207     * @return the overlay directory path, or null if not set
208     */
209    public String getOverlayDir() {
210        return overlayDir;
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Sets the IaCStreamingAccumulator for cowsay display.
215     *
216     * @param accumulator the accumulator to use for cowsay display
217     */
218    public void setAccumulator(IaCStreamingAccumulator accumulator) {
219        this.accumulator = accumulator;
220    }
221
222    /**
223     * Gets the IaCStreamingAccumulator for cowsay display.
224     *
225     * @return the cowsay accumulator, or null if not set
226     */
227    public IaCStreamingAccumulator getAccumulator() {
228        return accumulator;
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Hook called when entering a transition during workflow execution.
233     *
234     * <p>Displays the workflow name and first 10 lines of the transition definition
235     * in YAML format using cowsay to provide visual separation between workflow steps.</p>
236     *
237     * @param transition the transition being entered
238     */
239    @Override
240    protected void onEnterTransition(Transition transition) {
241        // Get workflow name
242        String workflowName = (getCode() != null && getCode().getName() != null)
243                ? getCode().getName()
244                : "unknown-workflow";
245
246        // Get YAML-formatted output (first 10 lines)
247        String yamlText = transition.toYamlString(10).trim();
248        this.currentTransitionYaml = yamlText;
249
250        // Render cowsay output
251        String cowsayOutput;
252        if (accumulator != null) {
253            cowsayOutput = accumulator.renderCowsay(workflowName, yamlText);
254        } else {
255            // Fallback to simple text if no accumulator
256            cowsayOutput = "[" + workflowName + "]\n" + yamlText;
257        }
258
259        // Send cowsay output to outputMultiplexer (loose coupling via ActorSystem)
260        IIActorRef<?> multiplexer = system.getIIActor("outputMultiplexer");
261        if (multiplexer != null) {
262            JSONObject arg = new JSONObject();
263            // Use actor name as source (consistent across all output)
264            arg.put("source", selfActorRef != null ? selfActorRef.getName() : "unknown");
265            arg.put("type", "cowsay");
266            arg.put("data", cowsayOutput);
267            multiplexer.callByActionName("add", arg.toString());
268        }
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * Returns the current transition YAML snippet for accumulator reporting.
273     *
274     * @return the first 10 lines of the current transition in YAML format
275     */
276    public String getCurrentTransitionYaml() {
277        return currentTransitionYaml;
278    }
279
280    /**
281     * Loads and runs a workflow file to completion with overlay support.
282     *
283     * <p>If overlayDir is set, the workflow is loaded with overlay applied.
284     * Variables defined in overlay-conf.yaml are substituted before execution.</p>
285     *
286     * @param workflowFile the workflow file path (YAML or JSON)
287     * @param maxIterations maximum number of state transitions allowed
288     * @return ActionResult with success=true if completed, false otherwise
289     */
290    @Override
291    public ActionResult runWorkflow(String workflowFile, int maxIterations) {
292        // If no overlay is set, use parent implementation
293        if (overlayDir == null) {
294            return super.runWorkflow(workflowFile, maxIterations);
295        }
296
297        try {
298            // Reset state for fresh execution
299            reset();
300
301            // Resolve workflow file path
302            Path workflowPath;
303            if (workflowBaseDir != null) {
304                workflowPath = Path.of(workflowBaseDir, workflowFile);
305            } else {
306                workflowPath = Path.of(workflowFile);
307            }
308
309            // Load workflow with overlay applied
310            Path overlayPath = Path.of(overlayDir);
311            readYaml(workflowPath, overlayPath);
312
313            // Run until end
314            return runUntilEnd(maxIterations);
315
316        } catch (Exception e) {
317            logger.log(Level.SEVERE, "Error running workflow with overlay: " + workflowFile, e);
318            return new ActionResult(false, "Error: " + e.getMessage());
319        }
320    }
321
322    // ========================================================================
323    // Document Change Detection API (replaces /tmp file-based approach)
324    // ========================================================================
325
326    /**
327     * Detects changed documents and stores them in POJO state.
328     *
329     * <p>This method replaces the shell script that wrote to /tmp/changed_docs.txt.
330     * It reads the document list, checks git status for each, and stores changed
331     * document names in the changedDocuments set.</p>
332     *
333     * @param docListPath path to the document list file
334     * @return ActionResult with detection summary
335     * @throws IOException if file operations fail
336     */
337    public ActionResult detectDocumentChanges(String docListPath) throws IOException {
338        // Clear previous results
339        changedDocuments.clear();
340
341        // Expand ~ to home directory
342        String expandedPath = docListPath.replace("~", System.getProperty("user.home"));
343        Path listPath = Path.of(expandedPath);
344
345        if (!Files.exists(listPath)) {
346            return new ActionResult(false, "Document list not found: " + docListPath);
347        }
348
349        // Check for FORCE_FULL_BUILD environment variable
350        boolean forceBuild = "true".equalsIgnoreCase(System.getenv("FORCE_FULL_BUILD"));
351
352        StringBuilder summary = new StringBuilder();
353
354        if (forceBuild) {
355            summary.append("=== FORCE_FULL_BUILD enabled: processing all documents ===\n");
356        } else {
357            summary.append("=== Detecting changes via git fetch ===\n");
358        }
359
360        try (BufferedReader reader = Files.newBufferedReader(listPath)) {
361            String line;
362            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
363                line = line.trim();
364
365                // Skip comments and empty lines
366                if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#")) {
367                    continue;
368                }
369
370                // Parse: path git_url
371                String[] parts = line.split("\\s+", 2);
372                String path = parts[0].replace("~", System.getProperty("user.home"));
373                String docName = Path.of(path).getFileName().toString();
374
375                if (forceBuild) {
376                    changedDocuments.add(docName);
377                    summary.append("  [FORCE] ").append(docName).append("\n");
378                    continue;
379                }
380
381                // Check document status
382                Path docPath = Path.of(path);
383                Path gitPath = docPath.resolve(".git");
384
385                if (!Files.exists(docPath)) {
386                    // New document
387                    changedDocuments.add(docName);
388                    summary.append("  [NEW] ").append(docName).append("\n");
389                } else if (!Files.exists(gitPath)) {
390                    // Not a git repository
391                    changedDocuments.add(docName);
392                    summary.append("  [NO-GIT] ").append(docName).append("\n");
393                } else {
394                    // Check for remote changes using git
395                    String status = checkGitStatus(docPath);
396                    if (status.startsWith("[CHANGED]") || status.startsWith("[UNKNOWN]")) {
397                        changedDocuments.add(docName);
398                    }
399                    summary.append("  ").append(status).append(" ").append(docName).append("\n");
400                }
401            }
402        }
403
404        summary.append("\n=== Change detection summary ===\n");
405        if (changedDocuments.isEmpty()) {
406            summary.append("No changes detected. All documents are up to date.\n");
407        } else {
408            summary.append("Documents to process: ").append(changedDocuments.size()).append("\n");
409            for (String doc : changedDocuments) {
410                summary.append(doc).append("\n");
411            }
412        }
413
414        // Print summary (like the original shell script did)
415        System.out.println(summary);
416
417        return new ActionResult(true, "Detected " + changedDocuments.size() + " changed documents");
418    }
419
420    /**
421     * Checks git status for a document directory.
422     *
423     * @param docPath path to the document directory
424     * @return status string like "[CHANGED]", "[UP-TO-DATE]", or "[UNKNOWN]"
425     */
426    private String checkGitStatus(Path docPath) {
427        try {
428            // git fetch
429            ProcessBuilder fetchPb = new ProcessBuilder("git", "fetch", "origin");
430            fetchPb.directory(docPath.toFile());
431            fetchPb.redirectErrorStream(true);
432            Process fetchProcess = fetchPb.start();
433            fetchProcess.waitFor();
434
435            // Get local HEAD
436            String local = runGitCommand(docPath, "git", "rev-parse", "HEAD");
437
438            // Get remote HEAD (try main first, then master)
439            String remote = runGitCommand(docPath, "git", "rev-parse", "origin/main");
440            if (remote == null || remote.equals("unknown")) {
441                remote = runGitCommand(docPath, "git", "rev-parse", "origin/master");
442            }
443
444            if (local == null || remote == null || local.equals("unknown") || remote.equals("unknown")) {
445                return "[UNKNOWN] (cannot determine state)";
446            }
447
448            if (!local.equals(remote)) {
449                String localShort = local.length() > 7 ? local.substring(0, 7) : local;
450                String remoteShort = remote.length() > 7 ? remote.substring(0, 7) : remote;
451                return "[CHANGED] (local: " + localShort + ", remote: " + remoteShort + ")";
452            }
453
454            return "[UP-TO-DATE]";
455
456        } catch (Exception e) {
457            logger.log(Level.WARNING, "Error checking git status for " + docPath, e);
458            return "[UNKNOWN] (error: " + e.getMessage() + ")";
459        }
460    }
461
462    /**
463     * Runs a git command and returns the output.
464     */
465    private String runGitCommand(Path workDir, String... command) {
466        try {
467            ProcessBuilder pb = new ProcessBuilder(command);
468            pb.directory(workDir.toFile());
469            pb.redirectErrorStream(true);
470            Process process = pb.start();
471
472            try (BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(process.getInputStream()))) {
473                String line = reader.readLine();
474                process.waitFor();
475                return line != null ? line.trim() : "unknown";
476            }
477        } catch (Exception e) {
478            return "unknown";
479        }
480    }
481
482    /**
483     * Checks if a specific document is in the changed list.
484     *
485     * @param docName the document name to check
486     * @return true if the document was detected as changed
487     */
488    public boolean isDocumentChanged(String docName) {
489        return changedDocuments.contains(docName);
490    }
491
492    /**
493     * Gets the number of changed documents.
494     *
495     * @return the count of changed documents
496     */
497    public int getChangedDocumentsCount() {
498        return changedDocuments.size();
499    }
500
501    /**
502     * Gets all changed document names.
503     *
504     * @return unmodifiable set of changed document names
505     */
506    public Set<String> getChangedDocuments() {
507        return Set.copyOf(changedDocuments);
508    }
509
510    /**
511     * Checks if there are any changed documents to process.
512     *
513     * @return true if at least one document needs processing
514     */
515    public boolean hasChangedDocuments() {
516        return !changedDocuments.isEmpty();
517    }
518
519    /**
520     * Clears the changed documents list.
521     */
522    public void clearChangedDocuments() {
523        changedDocuments.clear();
524    }
525
526    /**
527     * Adds a document to the changed list (for testing or manual override).
528     *
529     * @param docName the document name to add
530     */
531    public void addChangedDocument(String docName) {
532        changedDocuments.add(docName);
533    }
534
535    /**
536     * Clones changed documents from git.
537     *
538     * <p>Only clones documents that are in the changedDocuments set.
539     * Removes existing directory and does fresh clone to avoid conflicts.</p>
540     *
541     * @param docListPath path to the document list file
542     * @return ActionResult with clone summary
543     * @throws IOException if operations fail
544     */
545    public ActionResult cloneChangedDocuments(String docListPath) throws IOException {
546        if (changedDocuments.isEmpty()) {
547            System.out.println("=== No documents to clone (all up to date) ===");
548            return new ActionResult(true, "No documents to clone");
549        }
550
551        String expandedPath = docListPath.replace("~", System.getProperty("user.home"));
552        Path listPath = Path.of(expandedPath);
553
554        // Ensure ~/works exists
555        node.executeCommand("mkdir -p ~/works");
556
557        System.out.println("=== Cloning changed documents ===");
558        int clonedCount = 0;
559
560        try (BufferedReader reader = Files.newBufferedReader(listPath)) {
561            String line;
562            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
563                line = line.trim();
564                if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#")) continue;
565
566                String[] parts = line.split("\\s+", 2);
567                String path = parts[0];
568                String gitUrl = parts.length > 1 ? parts[1] : null;
569                String docName = Path.of(path).getFileName().toString();
570
571                if (!changedDocuments.contains(docName)) {
572                    System.out.println("  [SKIP] " + docName + " (unchanged)");
573                    continue;
574                }
575
576                if (gitUrl != null && !gitUrl.isEmpty()) {
577                    // Remove old and clone fresh
578                    System.out.println("=== Cloning: " + gitUrl + " -> " + path + " ===");
579                    node.executeCommand("rm -rf " + path);
580                    Node.CommandResult result = node.executeCommand("git clone " + gitUrl + " " + path);
581                    if (result.getExitCode() == 0) {
582                        clonedCount++;
583                    } else {
584                        System.err.println("Clone failed: " + result.getStderr());
585                    }
586                } else {
587                    System.out.println("=== No git URL specified for: " + path + " ===");
588                }
589            }
590        }
591
592        return new ActionResult(true, "Cloned " + clonedCount + " documents");
593    }
594
595    /**
596     * Builds changed Docusaurus documents.
597     *
598     * <p>Only builds documents that are in the changedDocuments set.</p>
599     *
600     * @param docListPath path to the document list file
601     * @return ActionResult with build summary
602     * @throws IOException if operations fail
603     */
604    public ActionResult buildChangedDocuments(String docListPath) throws IOException {
605        if (changedDocuments.isEmpty()) {
606            System.out.println("=== No documents to build (all up to date) ===");
607            return new ActionResult(true, "No documents to build");
608        }
609
610        String expandedPath = docListPath.replace("~", System.getProperty("user.home"));
611        Path listPath = Path.of(expandedPath);
612
613        System.out.println("=== Building changed documents ===");
614        int builtCount = 0;
615
616        try (BufferedReader reader = Files.newBufferedReader(listPath)) {
617            String line;
618            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
619                line = line.trim();
620                if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#")) continue;
621
622                String[] parts = line.split("\\s+", 2);
623                String path = parts[0];
624                String docName = Path.of(path).getFileName().toString();
625
626                if (!changedDocuments.contains(docName)) {
627                    System.out.println("  [SKIP] " + docName + " (unchanged)");
628                    continue;
629                }
630
631                System.out.println("=== Building: " + path + " ===");
632                Node.CommandResult result = node.executeCommand(
633                    "cd " + path + " && yarn install && yarn build"
634                );
635                if (result.getExitCode() == 0) {
636                    builtCount++;
637                } else {
638                    System.err.println("Build failed for " + docName + ": " + result.getStderr());
639                }
640            }
641        }
642
643        return new ActionResult(true, "Built " + builtCount + " documents");
644    }
645
646    /**
647     * Copies changed document builds to public_html.
648     *
649     * <p>Only copies documents that are in the changedDocuments set.</p>
650     *
651     * @param docListPath path to the document list file
652     * @return ActionResult with copy summary
653     * @throws IOException if operations fail
654     */
655    public ActionResult deployChangedDocuments(String docListPath) throws IOException {
656        // Ensure public_html exists
657        node.executeCommand("mkdir -p ~/public_html");
658
659        if (changedDocuments.isEmpty()) {
660            System.out.println("=== No documents to copy (all up to date) ===");
661            node.executeCommand("ls -la ~/public_html/");
662            return new ActionResult(true, "No documents to copy");
663        }
664
665        String expandedPath = docListPath.replace("~", System.getProperty("user.home"));
666        Path listPath = Path.of(expandedPath);
667
668        System.out.println("=== Copying changed documents to public_html ===");
669        int copiedCount = 0;
670
671        try (BufferedReader reader = Files.newBufferedReader(listPath)) {
672            String line;
673            while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
674                line = line.trim();
675                if (line.isEmpty() || line.startsWith("#")) continue;
676
677                String[] parts = line.split("\\s+", 2);
678                String path = parts[0];
679                String docName = Path.of(path).getFileName().toString();
680
681                if (!changedDocuments.contains(docName)) {
682                    System.out.println("  [SKIP] " + docName + " (unchanged)");
683                    continue;
684                }
685
686                String buildPath = path + "/build";
687                String destPath = "~/public_html/" + docName;
688
689                System.out.println("=== Copying " + docName + " to public_html ===");
690                node.executeCommand("rm -rf " + destPath);
691                Node.CommandResult result = node.executeCommand(
692                    "cp -r " + buildPath + " " + destPath
693                );
694                if (result.getExitCode() == 0) {
695                    copiedCount++;
696                } else {
697                    System.err.println("Copy failed for " + docName + ": " + result.getStderr());
698                }
699            }
700        }
701
702        System.out.println("=== public_html contents ===");
703        node.executeCommand("ls -la ~/public_html/");
704
705        return new ActionResult(true, "Deployed " + copiedCount + " documents");
706    }
707}
